III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member employment was terminated because of boundary
issues with youth. She would favor Youth A over other residents
allegedly because he reminded her of a son his age. Recently,
youth asked a staff member if she has been terminated because
she was his girlfriend, and he made a comment that he "got that".
Youth was questioned about his relationship with staff and denied
that anything ever happened between them. Staff member is no
longer employed at the facility and there is no contact between
youth and staff.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant
I spoke with Complainant on 02/26/2024. Complainant did not
have additional information.
Youth A
I attended Youth A’s forensic interview on 03/14/2024 by video
conference. Youth A did not mention any favoritism or relationship
with Staff Person 1. Youth A denied talking to a staff person about
a staff person’s inappropriate behavior with him. I interviewed
Youth A on 03/21/2024 at Mott Childrens Residence with another
Department of Health and Human Service Worker. Youth A stated
he knows Staff Person 1. Youth A stated Staff Person 1 no longer
works at Mott Childrens Residence, but she was a “cool” staff.
Youth A stated he was on a safety plan that involved not having
contact with Staff Person 1. Youth A denied any boundary
concerns with staff. Youth A stated youths do not have personal
cell phones and are not allowed to use a staff person’s cell phone.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B on 03/21/2024 at Mott Childrens Residence
with another Department of Health and Human Service Worker.
2

Youth B stated he knows Youth A from McDonald Unit at Mott
Childrens Residence. Youth B was asked about Youth A and Staff
Person 1. Youth B stated Youth A would take Staff Person 1’s cell
phone and take pictures of the unit while Staff Person 1 followed
and verbally redirected Youth A to return her cell phone. Youth B
stated he recalled an incident when Staff Person 1 sat in a chair
and Youth A got up and sat sideways behind Staff Person 1 with
his legs hanging over the chair arm. Youth B stated Staff Person 1
did not redirect Youth A in this incident. Youth B stated Staff
Person 1 rarely took youths on outings.
Youth C
I interviewed Youth C on 03/21/2024 at Mott Childrens Residence
with another Department of Health and Human Service Worker.
Youth C stated he knows Youth A from McDonald Unit at Mott
Childrens Residence. Youth C stated he knew the reason for the
interview and said it was about Youth A trying to flirt with Staff
Person 1. Youth C was asked to explain what he meant. Youth C
stated Youth A said, “You look fine today” to Staff Person 1 and
Staff Person 1 would ignore Youth A. Youth C stated he never
saw Youth A and Staff Person 1 sit next to each other. Youth C
did not recall Staff Person 1 taking an individual youth on an
outing. Youth C stated staff treat all youths the same and do not
have favorites.
Staff Person 1
Another Department of Health and Human Service Worker and I
went to Staff Person 1’s last known home address on 03/21/2024.
Staff Person 1 no longer resides at this address. The house was
being repainted for new tenants. I called and left a message for
Staff Person 1 on 03/22/2024 and did not receive a return call. I
attempted to reach Staff Person 1 again on 03/29/2024. I was
unable to leave a message because her voicemail box was full.
Staff Person 2
I interviewed Staff Person 2 on 03/21/2024 at Mott Childrens
Residence with another Department of Health and Human Service
Worker. Staff Person 2 stated he works at Optimist House but has
worked on McDonald Unit at Mott Childrens Residence. Staff
Person 2 stated he recently (around 02/22/2024) had the following
conversation with Youth A about Staff Person 1.
Youth A asked, “Have you heard rumors about me?” Staff Person
2 asked, “Are they true?” Youth A said, “I did that.” Staff Person 2
asked, “What happened?” Staff Person 2 stated Youth A did not
respond.
3

Staff Person 2 said he never worked with Staff Person 1 on
McDonald Unit.
Director of Residential Services
I interviewed Director of Residential Services on 03/21/2024 at
Mott Childrens Residence with another Department of Health and
Human Service Worker. Director of Residential Services stated
she saw, on live video, Youth A slide into a seated position behind
Staff Person 1, who was sitting in a chair behind the staff desk on
McDonald Unit’s on 12/04/2023. Director of Residential Services
stated Youth A’s legs were spread apart, one leg on each side of
Staff Person 1, and Staff Person 1 did not redirect Youth A.
Director of Residential Services stated she explained the
boundary issue to Staff Person 1, moved Staff Person 1 off
McDonald Unit, and placed Staff Person 1 on a safety plan, which
involved no contact with Youth A. Director of Residential Services
stated Staff Person 1 disagreed with the safety plan and said, “I
just love my kids.” Director of Residential Services stated Staff
Person 1 was verbally reprimanded by Residential Manager on
12/04/2023 when Staff Person 1 violated the safety plan by
speaking with Youth A in McDonald’s Unit’s staff office. Director of
Residential Services stated Staff Person 1 explained she was de-
escalating Youth A and then left McDonald Unit per the safety
plan. Director of Residential Services stated Staff Person 1 spoke
with Resident Support Manager on 01/02/2024 about staff
misspeaking about her dating Youth A. Director of Residential
Services stated she requested Staff Person 1 write a statement,
but Staff Person 1 was placed on administrative leave on
01/31/2024 and terminated on 02/07/2024 and the written
statement was not received.
Residential Manager
I interviewed Residential Manager on 03/21/2024 at Mott
Childrens Residence with another Department of Health and
Human Service Worker. Residential Manager stated on
12/04/2023 Director of Residential Services placed Staff Person 1
on a safety plan and moved her off McDonald Unit after viewing a
live video of Youth A sitting behind Staff Person 1 in the same
chair. Residential Manager stated Staff Person 1 was later seen
on 12/04/2023 with Youth A in the McDonald Unit staff office.
Residential Manager stated she met with Staff Person 1 on
12/04/2023 and reiterated the safety plan that she was not to have
contact with Youth A. Residential Manager stated Staff Person 1
explained she was de-escalating Youth A, apologized for not
following the safety plan, and left McDonald Unit.
4

Residential Support Manager
I interviewed Residential Support Manager on 03/21/2024 at Mott
Childrens Residence with another Department of Health and
Human Service Worker. Residential Support Manager stated she
was Staff Person 1’s direct supervisor. Residential Support
Manager stated she never observed Staff Person 1 with boundary
or youth favoritism issues. Residential Support Manager stated
she met with Staff Person 1 regarding her safety plan of not
having contact with Youth A two days after the incident
(12/06/2023). Residential Support Manager stated Staff Person 1
agreed with the safety plan without questions.
Documentation
• 12/2023 safety plan states Staff Person 1 may not work on
Youth A’s unit or be in Youth A’s classroom.
• Director of Residential Services wrote a response to Staff
Person 1’s 12/04/2023 incident with Youth A. It states video
at 8:55 AM showed Youth A sitting and eating next to Staff
Person 1. It states Youth A gets up and sits behind Staff
Person 1 in the same chair and whispers in her ear. It
states professional boundary safety plan is in place at
11:58 AM that prohibits Staff Person 1 having contact with
Youth A and Staff Person 1 is reassigned to another unit. It
states Staff Person 1 explained she was not trying to be
inappropriate with Youth A. It states Staff Person 1 was
requested to write a statement on 01/03/2024, 01/05/2024,
01/10/2024, 01/11/2024, 01/17/2024, and 01/31/2024 after
Staff Person 1 reported staff were misspeaking about her
and Youth A. It states Staff Person 1’s statement was never
received.
• Staff Person 1 was hired on 08/09/2021 and terminated on
02/07/2024. Staff Person 1 signed and dated her
termination letter on 02/07/2024.
Video
There is no video footage to review because it was a live,
unrecorded video review on 12/04/2023.
Observation
The chair from the incident is a wide and heavy armchair from a
juvenile facility furniture company.
Another Department of Health and Human Service Agency
completed an investigation without finding.
5

Analysis It cannot be determined from the interviews if Staff person 1 and
Youth A engaged in a relationship outside the scope of staff and
resident. Mott Childrens Residence acted on 12/04/2023 by
prohibiting Staff Person 1 to have contact with Youth A and
reassigning Staff Person 1 to another unit. Staff Person 1 and
Youth A did not have questionable boundaries or behaviors after
12/04/2023, but Staff Person 1’s employment was terminated on
02/07/2024. It is found that Mott Childrens Residence provided for
the needs, protection, and supervision of Youth A.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
